TypeSignature.Value: .class public auto ansi abstract beforefieldinit HttpURLConnection extends Java.Net.URLConnection

Docs.summary: An for HTTP () used to send and receive data over the web.

remarks.para: An for HTTP () used to send and receive data over the web. Data may be of any type and length. This class may be used to send and receive streaming data whose length is not known in advance.

Uses of this class follow a pattern:
Obtain a new HttpURLConnection by calling and casting the result to HttpURLConnection.
Prepare the request. The primary property of a request is its URI. Request headers may also include metadata such as credentials, preferred content types, and session cookies.
Optionally upload a request body. Instances must be configured with if they include a request body. Transmit data by writing to the stream returned by .
Read the response. Response headers typically include metadata such as the response body's content type and length, modified dates and session cookies. The response body may be read from the stream returned by . If the response has no body, that method returns an empty stream.
Disconnect. Once the response body has been read, the HttpURLConnection should be closed by calling . Disconnecting releases the resources held by a connection so they may be closed or reused.

If the HTTP response indicates that an error occurred, will throw an . Use to read the error response. The headers can be read in the normal way using ,
Posting Content To upload data to a web server, configure the connection for output using .

For best performance, you should call either when the body length is known in advance, or when it is not. Otherwise HttpURLConnection will be forced to buffer the complete request body in memory before it is transmitted, wasting (and possibly exhausting) heap and increasing latency.

When transferring large amounts of data to or from a server, use streams to limit how much data is in memory at once. Unless you need the entire body to be in memory at once, process it as a stream (rather than storing the complete body as a single byte array or string).

To reduce latency, this class may reuse the same underlying Socket for multiple request/response pairs. As a result, HTTP connections may be held open longer than necessary. Calls to may return the socket to a pool of connected sockets. This behavior can be disabled by setting the http.keepAlive system property to false before issuing any HTTP requests. The http.maxConnections property may be used to control how many idle connections to each server will be held.
The default CookieManager keeps all accepted cookies in memory. It will forget these cookies when the VM exits. Implement to define a custom cookie store.
In addition to the cookies set by HTTP responses, you may set cookies programmatically. To be included in HTTP request headers, cookies must have the domain and path properties set.

By default, new instances of HttpCookie work only with servers that support cookies. Many web servers support only the older specification, . For compatibility with the most web servers, set the cookie version to 0.

HttpURLConnection uses the GET method by default. It will use POST if has been called. Other HTTP methods (OPTIONS, HEAD, PUT, DELETE and TRACE) can be used with .
Proxies By default, this class will connect directly to the . It can also connect via an or proxy. To use a proxy, use when creating the connection.
IPv6 Support

This class includes transparent support for IPv6. For hosts with both IPv4 and IPv6 addresses, it will attempt to connect to each of a host's addresses until a connection is established.
Response Caching Android 4.0 (Ice Cream Sandwich, API level 15) includes a response cache. See android.net.http.HttpResponseCache for instructions on enabling HTTP caching in your application.
Avoiding Bugs In Earlier Releases Prior to Android 2.2 (Froyo), this class had some frustrating bugs. In particular, calling close() on a readable InputStream could . Work around this by disabling connection pooling:
Each instance of HttpURLConnection may be used for one request/response pair. Instances of this class are not thread safe.

Docs.param: A containing a Java Native Interface (JNI) object reference.
Docs.summary: A constructor used when creating managed representations of JNI objects; called by the runtime.

remarks.para: This constructor is invoked by the runtime infrastructure () to create a new managed representation for a Java Native Interface object.
The constructor will initializes the property of the new instance using and .

Docs.summary: If the HTTP chunked encoding is enabled this parameter defines the chunk-length.

remarks.para: If the HTTP chunked encoding is enabled this parameter defines the chunk-length. Default value is -1 that means the chunked encoding mode is disabled.

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig newslot virtual instance void Disconnect() cil managed

Docs.summary: Releases this connection so that its resources may be either reused or closed.

remarks.para: Releases this connection so that its resources may be either reused or closed.

Unlike other Java implementations, this will not necessarily close socket connections that can be reused. You can disable all connection reuse by setting the http.keepAlive system property to false before issuing any HTTP requests.

Docs.summary: Returns an input stream from the server in the case of an error such as the requested file has not been found on the remote server.

remarks.para: Returns an input stream from the server in the case of an error such as the requested file has not been found on the remote server. This stream can be used to read the data the server will send back.

Docs.summary: The byte count in the request body if it is both known and streamed; and -1 otherwise.

remarks.para: The byte count in the request body if it is both known and streamed; and -1 otherwise. If the byte count exceeds (2 GiB) then the value of this field will be . In that case use to access the exact byte count.

Docs.summary: The byte count in the request body if it is both known and streamed; and -1 otherwise.

remarks.para: The byte count in the request body if it is both known and streamed; and -1 otherwise. Prefer this field over the int-valued fixedContentLength on platforms that support both.

MemberSignature.Value: public static bool FollowRedirects { get; set; }

Docs.summary: Returns the value of followRedirects which indicates if this connection follows a different URL redirected by the server.

remarks.para:
Get method documentation [Android Documentation]
Returns the value of followRedirects which indicates if this connection follows a different URL redirected by the server. It is enabled by default.

Set method documentation [Android Documentation]
Sets the flag of whether this connection will follow redirects returned by the remote server.

Like Firefox and Chrome, this class doesn't honor this response code. Other implementations respond to this status code by retrying the request using the HTTP proxy named by the response's Location header field.

MemberSignature.Value: public virtual string RequestMethod { get; set; }

Docs.summary: Returns the request method which will be used to make the request to the remote HTTP server.

remarks.para:
Get method documentation [Android Documentation]
Returns the request method which will be used to make the request to the remote HTTP server. All possible methods of this HTTP implementation is listed in the class definition.

Set method documentation [Android Documentation]
Sets the request command which will be sent to the remote HTTP server. This method can only be called before the connection is made.

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig newslot virtual instance void SetChunkedStreamingMode(int32 chunklen) cil managed

Docs.summary: Stream a request body whose length is not known in advance.

remarks.para: Stream a request body whose length is not known in advance. Old HTTP/1.0 only servers may not support this mode.

When HTTP chunked encoding is used, the stream is divided into chunks, each prefixed with a header containing the chunk's size. A large chunk length requires a large internal buffer, potentially wasting memory. A small chunk length increases the number of bytes that must be transmitted because of the header on every chunk.
Implementation details: In some releases the chunkLength is treated as a hint: chunks sent to the server may actually be larger or smaller. To force a chunk to be sent to the server call .

Docs.exception: if already connected or another mode already set.

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig newslot virtual instance void SetFixedLengthStreamingMode(int32 contentLength) cil managed

Docs.param: the fixed length of the HTTP request body.
Docs.summary: Equivalent to setFixedLengthStreamingMode((long) contentLength), but available on earlier versions of Android and limited to 2 GiB.

remarks.para: Equivalent to setFixedLengthStreamingMode((long) contentLength), but available on earlier versions of Android and limited to 2 GiB.

Docs.exception: if already connected or another mode already set.
if contentLength is less than zero.

Docs.summary: Configures this connection to stream the request body with the known fixed byte count of contentLength.

Docs.summary: This API supports the Mono for Android infrastructure and is not intended to be used directly from your code.
Docs.value: A which contains the java.lang.Class JNI value corresponding to this type.

remarks.para: This property is used to control which jclass is provided to methods like .

Docs.summary: This API supports the Mono for Android infrastructure and is not intended to be used directly from your code.
Docs.value: A which provides the declaring type.

remarks.para: This property is used to control virtual vs. non virtual method dispatch against the underlying JNI object. When this property is equal to the declaring type, then virtual method invocation against the JNI object is performed; otherwise, we assume that the method was overridden by a derived type, and perform non-virtual methdo invocation.

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig newslot virtual instance bool UsingProxy() cil managed

Docs.summary: Returns whether this connection uses a proxy server or not.

remarks.para: Returns whether this connection uses a proxy server or not.
